weka.attributeSelection

Class EvolutionarySearch

  • java.lang.Object
    • weka.attributeSelection.ASSearch
      • weka.attributeSelection.EvolutionarySearch
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, StartSetHandler, OptionHandler, RevisionHandler

    public class EvolutionarySearch
extends ASSearch
implements StartSetHandler, OptionHandler
    EvolutionarySearch explores the attribute space using an Evolutionary Algorithm (EA).

    The EA is a (mu, lambda) one with the following operators:
    - uniform random initialization
    - binary tournament selection
    - single point crossover
    - bit flip mutation and
    - generational replacement with elitism (i.e., the best individual is always kept)

    This package has been properly designed to easily add new operators.
    Please, see the document entitled developers-guide.pdf available within this package.

    For more information about similar algorithms see: the NEO Group website

    Author:
    Sebastian Luna Valero
    See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • search

        public int[] search(ASEvaluation ASEval,
           Instances data)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        This is the inherited method to implement the search process in the selection of attributes. In our case, this method implements the Evolutionary Algorithm (EA).
        Specified by:
        search in class ASSearch
        Parameters:
        ASEval - is the attribute evaluator (selected by the user)
        data - are the training instances
        Returns:
        an array of the attributes selected by the EA (array of indexes)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if search can not be completed

      • listOptions

        public java.util.Enumeration<Option> listOptions()
        Returns an enumeration describing the available options.
        Specified by:
        listOptions in interface OptionHandler
        Returns:
        an enumeration of all the available options.

      • setOptions

        public void setOptions(java.lang.String[] options)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Parses a given list of options. 
         -population-size <number of individuals>
 The number of individuals in the population.
 (default = 20)
         -generations <number of generations>
 The number of generations to perform.
 (default = 20)
         -init-op <type of initialization>
 The operator to initialize the population.
 Available operators:
 0 = random initialization (default)
         -selection-op <type of selection>
 The operator to select individuals from the population.
 Available operators:
 0 = random selection
 1 = binary tournament (default)
         -crossover-op <type of crossover>
 The operator to cross individuals with each other.
 Available operators: 
 0 = single-point crossover (default)
         -crossover-probability <probability>
 The probability of crossover.
 (default = 0.6)
         -mutation-op <type of mutation>
 The operator to mutate individuals.
 Available operators:
 0 = bit-flip mutation (default)
         -mutation-probability <probability>
 The probability of mutation.
 (default = 0.1)
         -replacement-op <type of replacement>
 The operator to perform replacement.
 Available operators:
 0 = generational with elitism (default)
         -report-frequency <number of iterations>
 The number of iterations to report the population status.
 (default = 20)
         -seed <seed>
 Set the random number seed.
 (default = 1)
         -starting-set <list of attribute indexes>
 Specify a starting set of attributes.
 Eg. 1,3,5-7.If supplied, the starting set becomes
 one member of the initial population.
         -log-file <file name>
 Set the log file location.
 Log file keeps track of the best fitness found
 during all the iterations.
 (default = null)
        Specified by:
        setOptions in interface OptionHandler
        Parameters:
        options - the list of options as an array of strings.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if an option is not supported.

      • setStartSet

        public void setStartSet(java.lang.String startSet)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Sets a starting set of attributes for the search. It is the search method's responsibility to report this start set (if any) in its toString() method.
        Specified by:
        setStartSet in interface StartSetHandler
        Parameters:
        startSet - a string containing a list of attributes (and or ranges), eg. 1,2,6,10-15.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if start set can't be set.
